intro: Passerina paleacea, commonly known as the pale morning glory, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Passerina paleacea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
